input_sentence: At intersections and junctions ego must yield to the other vehicles coming from right side of ego.

atomic_propositions.description: Other vehicle is on right side of ego

temporal_relations.description: At intersection/junction with vehicle on right, ego must yield

lexicon.other_on_right: Other vehicle is on right side of ego

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Extract objects from objects list: obj_ego → ego, obj_other → other
2. Process atomic propositions:
   - ap_1: predicate="at_intersection", object="obj_ego" → at_intersection(ego)
   - ap_2: predicate="at_junction", object="obj_ego" → at_junction(ego) 
   - ap_3: predicate="in_right_of", object="obj_other", related_object="obj_ego" → in_right_of(other,ego)
   - ap_4: predicate="yield", object="obj_ego", related_object="obj_other" → yield(ego,other)
3. Construct antecedent: (at_intersection(ego) | at_junction(ego)) & in_right_of(other,ego)
4. Construct consequent: yield(ego,other)
5. Apply conditional relation: (antecedent) -> (consequent)
6. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

Final MTL Formula:
G ((at_intersection(ego) | at_junction(ego)) & in_right_of(other,ego) -> yield(ego,other))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Extract objects from objects list: obj_ego → ego, obj_other → other
2. Process atomic propositions:
   - ap_1: predicate="at_intersection", object="obj_ego" → at_intersection(ego)
   - ap_2: predicate="at_junction", object="obj_ego" → at_junction(ego) 
   - ap_3: predicate="in_right_of", object="obj_other", related_object="obj_ego" → in_right_of(other,ego)
   - ap_4: predicate="yield", object="obj_ego", related_object="obj_other" → yield(ego,other)
3. Construct antecedent: (at_intersection(ego) | at_junction(ego)) & in_right_of(other,ego)
4. Construct consequent: yield(ego,other)
5. Apply conditional relation: (antecedent) -> (consequent)
6. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- The formula begins with the global operator `G`, indicating a condition that must always hold true.
- The antecedent (condition part) contains two predicates connected by logical operators:
  - `at_intersection(ego)` is a unary predicate meaning "ego is at an intersection"
  - `at_junction(ego)` is a unary predicate meaning "ego is at a junction"  
  - These are combined with `|` (or), creating "ego is at an intersection or junction"
  - `in_right_of(other,ego)` is a relational predicate meaning "another vehicle is on the right side of ego"
  - The `&` (and) connects these conditions: "ego is at an intersection or junction AND another vehicle is on the right side of ego"
- The implication `->` indicates that when these conditions are true, the consequent must follow
- The consequent contains `yield(ego,other)`, a relational predicate meaning "ego yields to the other vehicle"
- The entire structure follows the pattern: Always, if [conditions], then [action]

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if the ego vehicle is at an intersection or junction and another vehicle is on the right side of the ego vehicle, then the ego vehicle must yield to the other vehicle.

verification_result.back_translation: Always, if the ego vehicle is at an intersection or junction and another vehicle is on the right side of the ego vehicle, then the ego vehicle must yield to the other vehicle.

  - `at_junction(ego)` is a unary predicate meaning "ego is at a junction"

  - `in_right_of(other,ego)` is a relational predicate meaning "another vehicle is on the right side of ego"
  - The `&` (and) connects these conditions: "ego is at an intersection or junction AND another vehicle is on the right side of ego"
- The implication `->` indicates that when these conditions are true, the consequent must follow

- The entire structure follows the pattern: Always, if [conditions], then [action]

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components

verifier.name: Verifier_Agent
verifier.description: Responsible for verifying the semantic correctness of MTL formulas through back-translation
